intro: Hieracium florentinum subsp. radiatum, commonly known as the Florentine hawkweed, is a flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its bright yellow ray florets and a basal rosette of leaves. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as meadows and grasslands. It has a hairy stem and is often found in temperate regions of Europe. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
